posts.post_content:
This is the grandson of Masticore, son to Razormane, and hell lot devastatng than it's father. We know the discarding handicap WOTC placed on him is to ensure we won't have the board full of him pounding away at your opponent.
  
   
Unlike his predeccesors, and look closely, you'll find that his discarding effect has become an advantage, a fuel for his '4 direct damage' ability. In this case, you would want to discard creatures from your hand. This also works well against black users as he will deny them the capability to raise your own dead against you. Masticore can pin off creatures but Molten-Tail can, for 2 extra colorless, pin players as well for 4.
  
   
So you can have him attack first, if you can't deal damage to opponents, remove a card, and ping him, and he comes into play at turn four. And he can regenerate well, a valuable \*\*\*et in Scars of Mirrodin set as there are no spells (probably) that deny regeneration, with infect and -1/-1 counters as an exception, you would've no doub... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This is the grandson of Masticore, son to Razormane, and hell lot devastatng than it's father. We know the discarding handicap WOTC placed on him is to ensure we won't have the board full of him pounding away at your opponent.

Unlike his predeccesors, and look closely, you'll find that his discarding effect has become an advantage, a fuel for his '4 direct damage' ability. In this case, you would want to discard creatures from your hand. This also works well against black users as he will deny them the capability to raise your own dead against you. Masticore can pin off creatures but Molten-Tail can, for 2 extra colorless, pin players as well for 4.

So you can have him attack first, if you can't deal damage to opponents, remove a card, and ping him, and he comes into play at turn four. And he can regenerate well, a valuable ***et in Scars of Mirrodin set as there are no spells (probably) that deny regeneration, with infect and -1/-1 counters as an exception, you would've no doub... posts.post_content:
has someone been pouring mercury into the water supply? why is this rated below 4 stars? oh yea, it has a *single* drawback. and despite this actually being slightly beneficial, people have become too accustomed to their BSA type cards.  
  
seriously, between this and a wurmcoil engine, this wins with just 6 mana available, *and* cleans up the tokens.

posts.post_content:
This is the Sensei's Divining Top of Scars of Mirrodin: it looks terrible until you see it in action.  
  
This card snipes anything for 4 damage, survives Day of Judgment and All is Dust, is resistant to burn, trades with Obstinate Baloth and Vengevine and lives, gets around Kor Firewalker and Malakir Bloodwitch, and is a 4/4 body for 4.  
  
It's "downside" is just more fuel for its abilities.  
  
I was \*\*\*ed when I saw that this got a Mythic slot ....then I saw it in action. This is, indeed, well worth its rarity.
posts.html:
This is the Sensei's Divining Top of Scars of Mirrodin: it looks terrible until you see it in action.

This card snipes anything for 4 damage, survives Day of Judgment and All is Dust, is resistant to burn, trades with Obstinate Baloth and Vengevine and lives, gets around Kor Firewalker and Malakir Bloodwitch, and is a 4/4 body for 4.

It's "downside" is just more fuel for its abilities.

I was ***ed when I saw that this got a Mythic slot ....then I saw it in action. This is, indeed, well worth its rarity.
